CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| non-fullerene PSC |
| PC71BM |
| PTATDPP |
| PTAFDPP |
| TA unit |
| DPP units |
| di-PBI |

Explanation:

* non-fullerene PSC: non-fullerene polymer solar cell
* PC71BM: [6,6]-Phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
* PTATDPP: Poly{4,8-bis[(2-ethylhexyl)oxy]benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene-2,6-diyl-alt-thieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-diyl}{3-fluoro-2-[(2-hexyldecyl)carbonyl]thieno[3,4-b]thiophenediyl}
* PTAFDPP: Poly{4,8-bis[(2-ethylhexyl)oxy]benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene-2,6-diyl-alt-thieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-diyl}{3-fluoro-2-[(2-hexyldecyl)carbonyl]thieno[2',3':4,5]thieno[3,2-b]indole-5,7-diyl}
* TA unit: Thienyl-substituted anthracene
* DPP units: Diketopyrrolopyrrole units
* di-PBI: A non-fullerene acceptor material for the PSC device

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| non-fullerene PSC |
| PC71BM |
| PTATDPP |
| di-PBI |

Explanation:

* non-fullerene PSC: non-fullerene polymer solar cell
* PC71BM: [6,6]-Phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester
* PTATDPP: Poly{4,8-bis[(2-ethylhexyl)oxy]benzo[1,2-b:4,5-b']dithiophene-2,6-diyl-alt-thieno[3,4-c]pyrrole-4,6-diyl}{3-fluoro-2-[(2-hexyldecyl)carbonyl]thieno[3,4-b]thiophenediyl}
* di-PBI: A non-fullerene acceptor material for the PSC device

The other entities such as TA unit, DPP units, and PTAFDPP are not material names but rather components or units of other materials.

We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Although the non-fullerene PSC exhibits a lower PCE than the PC71BM - based device , the promising photovoltaic performance over 4% PCE with decent photovoltaic parameters ( V OC , J SC and FF ) suggests that PTATDPP can be used as a universal donor material compatible with various electron acceptors for high performance PSCs . We have designed and synthesized two anthracene - based low band - gap copolymers , PTATDPP and PTAFDPP. Since the TA unit has a highly conjugated 2-D structure with a weak electron - donating nature , the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units shows a relatively low band - gap , a low - lying HOMO energy level , high crystallinity , and efficient charge transporting characteristics. The PSCs fabricated from PTATDPP and PTAFDPP with PC71BM exhibit PCEs as high as 7.02% and 5.22% , respectively. Furthermore , PTATDPP shows a promising PCE of 4.23% when a non-fullerene acceptor ( di-PBI ) is used as an electron acceptor material for the PSC device. These results not only demonstrate that thienyl-substituted anthracene is a very promising building block as an electron - donating unit of low band - gap polymers for high performance PSCs but also PTATDPP can be used as a universal electron donor material compatible with various electron acceptor materials in PSCs.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| 4% PCE (Photovoltaic Performance) |
| low band gap (of PTATDPP and PTAFDPP) |
| low lying HOMO energy level (of the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units) |
| high crystallinity (of the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units) |
| efficient charge transporting characteristics (of the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units) |
| 7.02% PCE (of the PSC fabricated from PTATDPP and PC71BM) |
| 5.22% PCE (of the PSC fabricated from PTAFDPP and PC71BM) |
| 4.23% PCE (of the PSC using PTATDPP and di-PBI) |

Note: PCE stands for Power Conversion Efficiency. HOMO stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital. TA stands for thienyl-substituted anthracene. DPP stands for diketopyrrolopyrrole. PC71BM stands for [6,6]-Phenyl-C71-butyric acid methyl ester. di-PBI stands for a non-fullerene acceptor material.

| efficient charge transporting characteristics (of the copolymer composed of TA and DPP units) |
| 7.02% PCE (of the PSC fabricated from PTATDPP and PC71BM) |
| 5.22% PCE (of the PSC fabricated from PTAFDPP and PC71BM) |
| 4.23% PCE (of the PSC using PTATDPP and di-PBI) |

Note: PCE stands for Power Conversion Efficiency. HOMO stands for Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital. TA stands for thienyl-substituted anthracene. DPP stands for diketopyrrolopyrrole.
